Experience

Mnemba Island is a tropical paradise of coral reefs, powdery beaches & turquoise water found just off the coast of Zanzibar - & just 1,5km in circumference.
Lying on this dreamy isle is Mnemba Island Lodge – a small & intimate boutique-style beach resort with a dedication to providing only the best in barefoot luxury.
The resort is home to a PADI dive school & 2 dive boats, allowing guests to venture to the ocean when they want. Complimentary non-motorized water sports like kayaking & windsurfing are available to Mnemba Island guests & the permanent beach is ideal for swimming.
The island is also home to a fascinating green turtle population that can be seen between April & August each year. Shoes are not necessary on the island, so enjoy the laid-back island atmosphere with no dress code…& no shoes!

Stay

The resort is small & intimate, consisting of only 10 thatched beach bandas that are tucked into a tropical forest. Two of these bandas are situated within close proximity to one another & can accommodate a family of four.
Footsteps away – you will find the beach & crystal-clear ocean with warm water, great visibility & around 430 species of fish, including the treasured whale shark.
Each beach banda boasts a covered walkway leading to a shuttered en-suite bathroom. There are built-in barazas on the veranda – a great spot for afternoon siestas & private beach salas with traditional Zanzibari loungers for lazy beach days.
In the main area, you will find a restaurant, bar & Kids Club.

Activities

Activities at Mnemba Island Lodge include snorkelling, diving, fishing, kayaking, stand-up paddleboarding, windsurfing & deep-sea fishing.
Guests can also enjoy relaxing spa treatments, book a private dinner on the beach with a butler or send little ones to the Kids Club for some island adventures.

subfolders.title: Baraza Resort & Spa
subfolders.description: Baraza Resort & Spa is Zanzibar’s most exclusive boutique resort & is located along the beach that was named as one of the top 30 in the world by the prestigious Conde Nast Traveler magazine. This all-inclusive resort evokes the heritage of Zanzibar dating back to the era of the Sultans.  Baraza’s design is an interesting mix of Arabic, Swahili & Indian influence, with intricate hand-carved cement décor, beautiful antiques, handmade furniture & brass lanterns.

subfolders.title: Emerson Spice Hotel
subfolders.description: An ancient Merchant’s House has been lovingly restored over the years & is now one of Stone Town’s most renowned hotels:  The Emerson Spice. With an ideal setting in colourful Stone Town, it is here where guests will experience the real Zanzibar in contrast to glossy travel brochures.

subfolders.title: Fundu Lagoon
subfolders.description: Fundu Lagoon is located on Pemba Island, the sister island to Zanzibar lying across the Pemba Channel to the North.  Romantic, secluded & only accessible by boat, Fundu Lagoon provides only the best in barefoot luxury.

subfolders.title: Gold Zanzibar Beach House & Spa
subfolders.description: Located on Kendwa Beach in the far north-east of the spice island, you will find Gold Zanzibar Beach House & Spa. Virtually unaffected by the Indian Ocean’s tides, the resort overlooks one of the island’s best swimming beaches - the ideal place to float in the crystal-clear ocean or bask in the sun with a cocktail in hand.

subfolders.title: Kilindi Zanzibar
subfolders.description: The mesmerizing Kilindi Zanzibar is an exclusive boutique hotel located on the northwest coast of the island, overlooking the turquoise waters of the Indian Ocean. In a class of its own, Kilindi was originally designed by Benny Andersson, one of the members of the world-famous Abba pop music group.  The resort is a true blend of sophistication & barefoot luxury.

subfolders.title: Matemwe Retreat
subfolders.description: Matemwe Retreat is perched on an outcrop overlooking a shallow coral-fringed lagoon on the quieter northeast coast of Zanzibar island. Totally secluded from the mainstream tourist areas, Matemwe Retreat is adjacent to one of the best stretches of beach on the East Coast & offers 4 exclusive private villas set just meters from the Indian Ocean.

subfolders.title: Melia Zanzibar
subfolders.description: Set on the quiet northeast coast of Zanzibar – which is known as ‘Unguja’ in Swahili - & overlooking the gorgeous Indian Ocean, lies the lushly-landscaped private estate, Melia Zanzibar. This all-inclusive luxury beach resort boasts a 300m long white, sandy beach, a private beach club & a Kids Club to keep the little ones entertained.

subfolders.title: Mnemba Island Lodge
subfolders.description: Mnemba Island is a tropical paradise of coral reefs, powdery beaches & turquoise water found just off the coast of Zanzibar - & just 1,5km in circumference.    Lying on this dreamy isle is Mnemba Island Lodge – a small & intimate boutique-style beach resort with a dedication to providing only the best in barefoot luxury.

subfolders.title: Park Hyatt Zanzibar
subfolders.description: Park Hyatt is a 5-star luxury hotel in the heart of Stone Town, the capital of Zanzibar.   Stone Town is the oldest part of Zanzibar City.  Named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2000, it is known for its rich cultural heritage of Arab, Persian, Indian, and European elements.
